alert.note: Alert for Ozark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 06 at 9:37PM CST until March 09 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Douglas and Ozark. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 937 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Theodosia, Wasola, Noble, Willhoit, Rockbridge, Brixey, Thornfield and Gentryville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
